question.text: Which of the following is not a fundamental reason for greater biodiversity in tropics as compared to that of temperate regions?

options.text: Tropical latitudes have remained relatively undisturbed for millions of years
Temperate environments, unlike tropical ones, are less seasonal, relatively more constant and predictable
Temperate regions were subjected to frequent glaciations in the past
There is more solar energy available in the tropics which contributes to higher productivity

solution.text: Tropical environments, are less seasonal, and relatively more constant and predictable then temperate ones. Also temperate zones have undergone frequent changes in the past which has led to constant changing environmental conditions which is not favorable for species diversity where as tropical zones have more or less remained unchanged.
